skill.name: code-review
skill.description: Automated PR code review with multi-agent analysis
skill.summary: Automated PR code review with multi-agent analysis
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond documented GitHub CLI commands. The skill defines agent instructions for orchestrating code reviews.

content.value_statement: Code reviews take significant time and can miss important issues. This skill uses multiple specialized AI agents to automatically review pull requests with confidence scoring to filter false positives and highlight real problems.
actual_capabilities: Automatically checks if review is needed (skips closed, draft, trivial PRs)
Launches 4 parallel agents for comprehensive code analysis
Audits code against AGENTS.md compliance guidelines
Scans for bugs and logic errors in pull request diffs
Validates each issue with sub-agents before reporting
Posts inline comments or outputs terminal results with confidence scores
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI installed and authenticated
Cannot review code outside of pull request diffs
Only reports issues scoring 80 or higher confidence
Does not replace human review for complex architectural decisions

use_cases.title: Standardize Code Reviews
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent code quality across all team pull requests with automated multi-agent analysis

use_cases.title: Scale Review Capacity
use_cases.description: Handle more pull requests by automating initial code review and compliance checks

use_cases.title: Catch Bugs Early
use_cases.description: Identify bugs and logic issues before they reach production with confidence-scored findings

prompt_templates.scenario: Add inline review comments to PR

best_practices: Create clear AGENTS.md files with specific, testable rules for best results
Keep pull requests focused and reasonably sized for more accurate analysis
Use the --comment flag to post results directly in GitHub for team visibility
anti_patterns: Do not rely on automated review alone for security-critical or financial code
Do not ignore confidence scores - low confidence issues need human verification
Do not use for draft PRs or trivial changes that would waste review resources

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for executing code review workflows.

faq.question: What confidence threshold is used?
faq.answer: Only issues scoring 80 or higher are reported to minimize false positives.

faq.question: How does it integrate with GitHub?
faq.answer: Uses GitHub CLI commands to fetch PR data and post comments when the --comment flag is provided.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes - code is only processed locally through GitHub CLI and AI model context. No external data transfers.

faq.question: Why were no issues found?
faq.answer: The PR may be trivial, already reviewed, or the code passed all automated checks with high confidence.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax and style issues. This skill catches logic bugs, compliance violations, and architectural problems.
